definition: to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: Call it my weakness. Call it kindness, " one brigadier told The Guardian.
sentences.chinese: 那是我的弱点，我的善良，”一个准将告诉《卫报》。

sentences.english: Commodore, he's disabled the rudder chain, sir.
sentences.chinese: 准将，他把舵链松开了，先生。

sentences.english: The Air Commodore briefed the bomber crew on their dangerous mission.
sentences.chinese: 空军准将向轰炸机机组下达执行危险义务的各项指示。

sentences.english: A brigadier general encouraged the journalists to return.
sentences.chinese: 一名军队准将欢迎记者一行有机会再来。

sentences.english: He became a brigadier general before leaving the military in 1966.
sentences.chinese: 他的军人生涯升至准将，随后在1966年退伍。

sentences.english: Brigadier Chea Keo is the deputy commander of the Cambodian Military Region.
sentences.chinese: 谢乔准将是柬埔寨军区的副司令。

sentences.english: A general officer ranking above a brigadier general and bel ow a lieutenant general.
sentences.chinese: 一个军衔位于准将之上和中将之下的将官。

sentences.english: The Commodore briefed the bomber crew on their dangerous mission.
sentences.chinese: 空军准将向轰炸机机钻下达状行危险任务的各项指示。

sentences.english: At 23 he became brigadier general of volunteers in command of a Michigan cavalry brigade.
sentences.chinese: 23岁时他被任命为志愿军一个骑兵旅的准将。

sentences.english: Saw Lah Pwe said he doesn't know when the border clashes will end.
sentences.chinese: 苏拉培准将说，他不知道什么时候边境冲突终将结束。

definition: middle ranking officer in Chinese army/lieutenant colonel/commander
high ranking officer in Chinese army/colonel
junior ranking officer in Chinese army/major/lieutenant commander
